tasks.prompt:
Transform the uploaded portrait into a cinematic winter photo narrative presented in a three-frame collage format. Each image maintains a 4:3 aspect ratio, capturing a cold, desaturated, and lonely winter atmosphere with delicate falling snow and a cinematic tone.

The person’s facial features and identity remain unchanged.

Top frame: A close-up shot of the subject holding a transparent umbrella, dressed in a black overcoat and blue scarf, with snowflakes scattered across the scene. The person gazes melancholically toward the right, eyes full of quiet emotion.

Middle frame: A medium-wide side-view shot of the subject standing in an open snowy field, holding a transparent umbrella. The person looks toward the snowy landscape in the distance. The camera is positioned slightly to the side, capturing both the subject’s profile and the vast, snow-covered field with a line of bare winter trees in the background. The composition conveys calmness and emotional distance.

Bottom frame: A detailed facial close-up capturing the face and scarf. Snow rests clearly on the hair and scarf, with strands of hair slightly lifted by the wind. The soft lighting, subtle snow, and the faint edge of the transparent umbrella create a storytelling, cinematic mood.

All three images are composed into one cohesive triptych collage in a 3:4 overall format.

Transform the uploaded portrait into a cinematic winter photo narrative presented as a two-frame collage. Each image occupies half of the full 3:4 composition, depicting a cold, desaturated, and solitary winter scene with delicate falling snow and a cinematic tone.

The person’s facial features and identity remain unchanged.

Top frame: A 45-degree angled side-view close-up of the subject wearing a thick black overcoat and a chunky knitted black scarf, with snowflakes gently scattered across the scene. The person gazes wistfully toward the right, their expression calm yet filled with quiet melancholy. Add the subtitle: “Another winter has come.”

Bottom frame: A front-facing close-up taken slightly closer to the camera, showing the person looking directly forward. Capture fine facial details and scarf texture, with snow softly resting on the hair and fabric. The soft cinematic lighting and serene expression should convey depth and emotion. Add the subtitle: “Hope that you are well.”

Both frames are seamlessly combined into a single two-image collage in a 3:4 aspect ratio, evoking natural emotion, intimacy, and quiet cinematic storytelling.

tasks.prompt:
Transform the uploaded portrait into a cinematic winter photo narrative in a three-frame vertical collage (3:4 overall, each 4:3).
The person’s face, hairstyle, and skin tone must remain exactly as in the uploaded photo, with no alteration or stylization.

Scene:
A Japanese-style snowy evening near a lakeside or mountain village, filmed during blue hour.
Snow falls naturally with large drifting flakes and fine powder, illuminated by soft flash and cool ambient light for a cold yet poetic mood.
Overall tones are deep blue and white, with a subtle warm highlight on the skin and snow sparkle.

Composition:

Top Frame: Side or back view of the subject standing in falling snow, hands near face as if warming them, wearing a dark wool coat, blue scarf, and knit gloves. Lighting from behind emphasizes snow texture and hair shine.

Middle Frame: Medium shot of the subject gazing upward toward the snowy horizon. A faint sunset glow or lake reflection adds emotional calm. Optional bouquet for story detail.

Bottom Frame: Close-up portrait with soft flash, snowflakes on hair and scarf, and dramatic light-shadow contrast on the face — master-level cinematic lighting.

Style: Fujifilm Provia film tone, fine grain, natural skin blush, wind-lifted hair, visible breath haze, emotional realism.
Keywords: cinematic winter, Fujifilm tones, blue-hour snow, triptych collage, realistic portrait.
Negative prompt: no anime, no facial change, no smoothing, no unrealistic lighting.

Transform the uploaded portrait into a cinematic winter snow-portraits in a Japanese-style Fujifilm film aesthetic.
The person must retain their exact facial features, face shape, hairstyle, skin tone, and natural expression exactly as in the uploaded photo, with no alteration or stylization. Remove the original background completely and replace it with a realistic winter landscape of Hengdaohezi, covered in snow and softly illuminated by daylight.
The atmosphere should be tranquil, cold, and poetic, featuring snow falling in two distinct layers — large flakes drifting slowly and fine powder floating lightly — to create a dynamic, realistic depth of snowfall.
Keep the original hairstyle from the uploaded portrait, ensuring the same length, shape, and texture. For longer hair, it should be deep brown with soft waves, some strands lightly dusted with snow, others catching the light in motion. The outfit includes fluffy white earmuffs, an oversized plush blue scarf, and a black wool overcoat with visible snow on the sleeves and hem.
Apply a Fujifilm Provia film filter, with soft side or back lighting that outlines the hair and snowflakes with a subtle glow. Skin should look luminous and transparent, with natural blush on cheeks, nose tip, and chin, and a gentle tinted lip gloss. The photo should feature fine film grain, a slightly hazy cinematic depth, and a nostalgic winter tone.
Poses should look candid and emotional — such as gazing at falling snow, lightly touching the cheek, or smiling faintly. Add natural details like snowflakes on eyelashes and small props such as a snowman, the character sitting on a bench covered by snow, to add storytelling depth.
Aspect ratio: 2:3
Style: cinematic realism, Japanese winter film mood, Fujifilm Provia tones, fine grain, soft light.
Negative prompt: no anime, no illustration, no facial modification, no unrealistic lighting or textures — maintain true facial resemblance, original hairstyle, and photographic realism.

tasks.prompt:
Transform the uploaded portrait into a single 9:16 vertical cinematic winter portrait in a Japanese Fujifilm film aesthetic.
The person must retain 100% of their original facial features, face shape, hairstyle, and skin tone exactly as in the uploaded photo — with no alteration or stylization. The hairstyle must remain identical in cut, length, and texture.
Capture one single photo only, not a collage or series.
Composition:A half-body portrait taken from the front or a 45-degree side angle, showing the subject’s natural posture and a calm, realistic expression. The eyes must remain open, keeping natural gaze or subtle eye contact with the camera or softly gazing toward falling snow.
Background: Set in a quiet snowy forest or mountain landscape (e.g., Mount Hemu or Mount Tengu) during blue hour at dusk. The atmosphere should feel cold, tranquil, and cinematic, with realistic snowfall — a mix of large soft flakes and fine drifting powder illuminated by twilight.
Outfit & Styling: Keep hairstyle identical to the uploaded portrait. The person wears a structured black knee-length wool coat and an oversized, thick ethnic-patterned scarf, lightly dusted with snow on the collar and cuffs. Hair moves gently in the wind, catching faint highlights in the soft backlight.
Lighting & Tone: Use Fujifilm Provia-style film tone — cinematic soft light, slightly cool color temperature, with side or back lighting emphasizing the texture of hair and snow. The scene has a delicate winter haze and fine film grain for authenticity.
Skin & Detail: Keep skin realistic, translucent, and natural, showing pores and subtle blush on the cheeks and nose. Maintain the person’s exact facial proportions and expressions. Lips have a soft, warm tint.
Mood & Emotion: The subject may give a gentle smile or a calm, introspective gaze — expressing quiet warmth in a cold scene. The person hold a vintage kerosene lamp (warm yellow light) close to the face or look toward softly falling snowflakes. Do not generate closed eyes — keep a natural, open gaze.
Technical Details: Single photo only — no collage, no montage, no split frames.Realistic proportions (accurate head-to-body ratio, natural anatomy). Maintain cinematic depth of field with soft background blur.
Aspect ratio: 3:4
Style: cinematic realism, Fujifilm winter tone, fine film grain, emotional storytelling.
Negative prompt: no anime, no illustration, no collage, no multiple photos, no closed eyes, no face or hairstyle modification — maintain true likeness, open eyes, and photographic realism.

comments.folder_structure: Each task folder should contain 'Source' and 'Generated_Output' subfolders. For multi-image tasks, also include 'Additional' subfolder.
comments.reference_folder: Optional: Path to folder containing third set of images for 3-way comparison
comments.template_usage: use_comparison_template: true uses comparison_template_path (3 placeholders), false uses template_path (2 placeholders)
comments.use_multi_image: Set to true to enable dual-image mode from Additional folder, false for single-image mode
comments.output_group_tasks_by: Set to 0 (or omit) to create individual reports per task. Set to N (e.g., 4) to group N tasks into one combined report. Example: with 4 tasks and group_tasks_by=4, creates 1 report; with 8 tasks, creates 2 reports.

multi_image_config.enabled: Must be true to use multi-image features
multi_image_config.mode: sequential: consistent reproducible pairing | random_pairing: randomly select from Additional folder
multi_image_config.folders: Array of folder paths to select additional images from (typically ['../path/to/folder/Additional'])
multi_image_config.allow_duplicates: true for sequential mode (recommended) | false: try to avoid repeating combinations in random mode

comments.multi_image_example_single: Set 'use_multi_image': false to process only images from Source folder without additional images
comments.multi_image_example_dual: Set 'use_multi_image': true with multi_image_config to pair Source images with Additional folder images sequentially
